abstract: Microsoft reports net income rose six percent in first quarter to $5.74 billion, or 68 cents a share, despite weak growth in PC sales; revenue rose 7 percent to $17.37 billion.
snippet: The company’s results reflect weak growth in PC sales due to a lack of spending on information technology in an uncertain economy.
lead_paragraph: The company’s results reflect weak growth in PC sales due to a lack of spending on information technology in an uncertain economy.

headline.main: Microsoft Posts Gain Despite Soft PC Sales
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Posts Gain Despite Soft PC Sales
headline.seo: Microsoft Income Gains 6%, but Weak PC Sales Continue
